intro: Chailletia deflexa, commonly known as the flexible chailletia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers during the late spring and early summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
